Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the structural deficit two years ago was the largest ever in Wisconsin, when in fact it was the third highest in the past 14 years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement about the largest structural deficit.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the largest structural deficit occurred two years ago without considering earlier budgets or deficits.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the structural deficit, such as economic factors or other budgetary decisions made in the past.
